item.title: PCA Website Rebuild
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:

Peripherals that are needed include: Brand refresh with the same color palette, website redesign, business cards, designs for tote bags / T-shirts & handbills. Success Solution: PCA was thrilled at our efforts to rejuvenate their brand identity & bring […]

The post PCA Website Rebuild appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Straight to the point

Problem:

Redesign existing brand & website for the local Providence Community Acupuncture. Peripherals that are needed include: Brand refresh with the same color palette, website redesign, business cards, designs for tote bags / T-shirts & handbills.

Success

Solution:

PCA was thrilled at our efforts to rejuvenate their brand identity & bring their site back to life making the user journey more pleasant to keep current PCA customers & attract new ones, our team even received our own session of acupuncture.

Revamp

Process:

Our team was tasked with providing new print assets that would serve them for future clients and a website refresh that would be usable to new and existing users. We collectively had an equal roles in contributing to the design of each asset, however my main role was to structure the redesign of their current website. Using WordPress, we migrated their old site over so we could begin updating it.

Straight to the point!

Problem:

Redesign existing brand & website for the local Providence Community Acupuncture. Peripherals that are needed include: Brand refresh with the same color palette, website redesign, business cards, designs for tote bags / T-shirts & handbills.

Revamp

Process:

Tasked with providing new print assets  and a website refresh that would be usable to new and existing users. We collectively had an equal roles in contributing to the design of each asset, however my main role was to structure the redesign of their current website. Using WordPress, we migrated their old site over so we could begin updating it.

Success

Solution:

PCA was thrilled at our efforts to rejuvenate their brand identity & bring their site back to life making the user journey more pleasant to keep current PCA customers & attract new ones, our team even received our own session of acupuncture.

Testimonial

“Working with Shawn and the JWU design team was fun & resulted in meeting our main goals of the website & logo redesign for an established business…”

“They worked with us to get just the right feel for our new look and design… keeping both user and back-end maintenance in mind…”

“Shawn and his team were able to gently but firmly convince us to make important changes…”

“Now when our potential clients visit they find a well designed and attractive website.”

– Cris Monteiro  |  PCA Owner & Acupuncture Specialist

VISIT PCA WEBSITE

VISIT PCA WEBSITE

item.title: Equinox Promotional Concert
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
Rock & Roll All Nite! Problem: Develop a brand identity for a live concert being put on at Johnson & Wales University. Peripherals that are needed include: posters, stage backdrop, access passes, marketing promos, handbills & stickers. A team of myself and three other talented student designers teamed up with the SEEM class at JWU […]

The post Equinox Promotional Concert appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Rock & Roll All Nite!

Problem:

Develop a brand identity for a live concert being put on at Johnson & Wales University. Peripherals that are needed include: posters, stage backdrop, access passes, marketing promos, handbills & stickers. A team of myself and three other talented student designers teamed up with the SEEM class at JWU to put on a fall concert at the JWU Pepsi Forum.

Go big or go home.

Solution:

The end result was a huge success, the event had good turnout & the peripherals were effectively used by our client in their tasks for the venue. Our creative team got published by JWU, the blog is available on their site discussing our project roles.

Party Everyday!

Process:

Each team member was responsible for designing a particular asset that would be used to promote the concert. After getting the brand identity approved, I went to work creating the posters that would be printed out & distributed around the campus to advertise the event. As well as a multi poster backdrop that would be hung with pipe & drape at the live concert. Using Illustrator, the brand development that went into these peripherals was both effortless and strategic and solving the design problem.

item.title: Smaht Weather Mobile App
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
Wicked Smaht! Problem: Develop a user interface that will give access to the weather in the Greater New England area, but also incorporate a branding image behind it that makes the user want to keep coming back to use the app to check the weather. Out of the pahk! Solution: User testing concluded & improvements […]

The post Smaht Weather Mobile App appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Wicked Smaht!

Problem:

Develop a user interface that will give access to the weather in the Greater New England area, but also incorporate a branding image behind it that makes the user want to keep coming back to use the app to check the weather.

Out of the pahk!

Solution:

User testing concluded & improvements were made from feedback to enhance the app to be better for all users. The subtle brand humor was enjoyed & the app came together with excellent functionality, easy navigation & aspect ratio responsiveness.

Data Driven

Process:

I started with assembling a strong, trusting & professional branding image with a hint of New England verbiage humor to keep the user engage in a simple weather app. Sketches & wireframes were created, tested & used actual live weather data from an API. Smaht Weather is a real live working app that was built in HTML, CSS & Sass, pulled data from DarkSky API, animated and brought to life through After Effects and Javascript.

Wicked Smaht!

Problem:

Develop a user interface that will give access to the weather in the Greater New England area, but also incorporate a branding image behind it that makes the user want to keep coming back to use the app to check the weather.

Party Time!

Process:

I started with assembling a strong, trusting & professional branding image with a hint of New England verbiage humor to keep the user engage in a simple weather app. Sketches & wireframes were created, tested & used actual live weather data from an API. Smaht Weather is a real live working app that was built in HTML, CSS & Sass, pulled data from DarkSky API, animated and brought to life through After Effects and Javascript.

Out of the Pahk!

Solution:

User testing concluded & improvements were made from feedback to enhance the app to be better for all users. The subtle brand humor was enjoyed & the app came together with excellent functionality, easy navigation & aspect ratio responsiveness.

CHECK THE WEATHER

item.title: RISK Quik Quit App
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
Weighing the risks Problem: Create an app that features a non-profit that entices a target audience. An app to help a smoker quit their habit, main dilemma is how to create an app that is both attractive, easy to use and keeps the user engaged long enough to quit smoking. https://shawnupdike.github.io/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/RISK-App-Video.mp4 Sending a message Solution: […]

The post RISK Quik Quit App appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Weighing the risks

Problem:

Create an app that features a non-profit that entices a target audience. An app to help a smoker quit their habit, main dilemma is how to create an app that is both attractive, easy to use and keeps the user engaged long enough to quit smoking.

Sending a message

Solution:

This campaign was targeted towards teens and young adults as they are the ones most at risk from these products. Funtionality of the app worked very well in concept. The hope is to bring the app to full development and have it live on the app store for those to download.

Give context.

Process:

Drafts started with sketches & wireframes to map out the layout & functionality of the app before it came time to finally develop. Once all the pieces were in place, the app moved to development using Adobe XD. Creating an infographic and app that enlightens smokers & those who may not know all that much about the risks.

Weighing the risks...

Problem:

Create an app that features a non-profit that entices a target audience. An app to help a smoker quit their habit, main dilemma is how to create an app that is both attractive, easy to use and keeps the user engaged long enough to quit smoking.

Give context

Process:

Drafts started with sketches & wireframes to map out the layout & functionality of the app before it came time to finally develop. Once all the pieces were in place, the app moved to development using Adobe XD. Creating an infographic and app that enlightens smokers & those who may not know all that much about the risks.

Sending a message

Solution:

This campaign was targeted towards teens and young adults as they are the ones most at risk from these products. Funtionality of the app worked very well in concept. The hope is to bring the app to full development and have it live on the app store for those to download.
